<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<I>
	(b) Litigation
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0">
<I>
	Kern Health Systems
</I>
	: In August 2011, in
	the Superior Court of the State of California, County of Los Angeles, Kern Health Systems (&ldquo;KHS&rdquo;) sought to recover
	in excess of $7.0 million exclusive of interest, attorneys&rsquo; fees and costs, against HMS&rsquo;s wholly owned subsidiary
	Allied Management Group Special Investigation Unit, Inc. (&ldquo;AMG&rdquo;) and two of AMG&rsquo;s former owners Dennis Demetre
	and Lori Lewis (collectively, the &ldquo;Defendants&rdquo;), jointly and severally, on causes of action for breach of contract,
	professional negligence, intentional misrepresentation, negligent misrepresentation and unfair business practices under the California
	Business and Professions Code. In June 2014, the jury issued its verdict in favor of all the Defendants, and against KHS, on all
	causes of action except negligent misrepresentation. On that cause of action, the jury issued a verdict against all the Defendants,
	jointly and severally, in the sum of $1.38 million. The negligent misrepresentation verdict was based on representations to KHS
	allegedly made by AMG and Demetre in the spring of 2008, prior to the Company&rsquo;s acquisition of AMG. HMS believes that the
	jury erroneously awarded damages based on an error inasmuch as the jury unanimously found that the Defendants (through Demetre)
	made the negligent misrepresentation to KHS while having reasonable grounds for believing the representation to be true. Based
	on the jury&rsquo;s verdict, HMS believes AMG is properly characterized as the prevailing party on the breach of contract claim.
	AMG has filed an appeal of the verdict and is seeking to recover its attorneys&rsquo; fees and costs in the sum of approximately
	$2.3 million. HMS has not recorded an obligation at this time, as the Company continues to believe that it is probable that AMG
	will prevail on the appeal of this matter, although there are risks and uncertainties related to any litigation, including appeals,
	and neither the Company nor its counsel can assure litigation results. Pending the appeal process, HMS was required to obtain
	a surety bond in the amount of 150% of the final judgment amount, or approximately $2.2 million, which was collateralized by a
	cash deposit and is reflected in other current assets on the Company&rsquo;s Consolidated Balance Sheet as of December 31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<I>
	Dennis Demetre
	and Lori Lewis
</I>
	: In July 2012, Dennis Demetre and Lori Lewis (the &#8220;Plaintiffs&#8221;), filed an action in the Supreme
	Court of the State of New York against HMS Holdings Corp., claiming an undetermined amount of damages alleging that various actions
	unlawfully deprived the Plaintiffs of the acquisition earn-out portion of the purchase price of AMG under the applicable Stock
	Purchase Agreement (the &#8220;SPA&#8221;) and that HMS had breached certain contractual provisions under the SPA. The Plaintiffs
	filed a second amended complaint with two causes of action for breach of contract and one cause of action for breach of implied
	covenant of good faith and fair dealing. Although the Plaintiffs also alleged an action based on fraud, the court dismissed that
	claim and further denied their subsequent appeal to resurrect the dismissed claim. HMS filed a counterclaim for breach of contract
	arising out of the Plaintiffs&#8217; failure to indemnify the Company for costs, including attorneys&#8217; fees arising out of
	the Company&#8217;s defense of the
<I>
	Kern Health Systems
</I>
	matter described above and for fraud and negligent misrepresentation
	arising out of the Plaintiffs&#8217; misrepresentations concerning capabilities of their software platform. In July 2015, the
	court granted in part and denied in part the Plaintiffs&#8217; motion to dismiss HMS&#8217;s counterclaims, allowing its counterclaim
	for breach of contract to proceed but dismissing the counterclaims for fraud and negligent misrepresentation. On January 4, 2016,
	HMS moved for summary judgment on (i) its remaining counterclaim for breach of contract against the Plaintiffs and (ii) the Plaintiffs&#8217;
	breach of contract causes of action against HMS. A pretrial conference has been set for April 2016 but no trial date has been
	set. HMS believes it has a meritorious defense and will continue to defend this matter vigorously, although there are risks and
	uncertainties related to any litigation. As such, HMS has not accrued for any loss contingencies related to this matter because
	no assessment can been made as to the likely outcome of this lawsuit or whether the outcome will be material to the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 72; VALUE: 1 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 4PT SOLID">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	69
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage73"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0">
<I>
	Restrictive Covenants, Trade Secret, Contract
	and other Causes of Action in Texas and New York
</I>
	: HMS is the plaintiff in lawsuits filed in August 2014, entitled
<I>
	HMS Holdings
	Corp., et al. v. Public Consulting Group, Inc., James Gambino and Jason Ramos
</I>
	, in the District Court of Dallas County, Texas
	(the &ldquo;Texas Action&rdquo;), and
<I>
	HMS Holdings Corp., et al. v. Matthew Arendt, Sean Curtin and Danielle Lange
</I>
	, in
	the New York State Supreme Court, Albany County (the &ldquo;New York Action&rdquo;). In July 2015, HMS filed a third related lawsuit,
	entitled
<I>
	HMS Holdings Corp., et al. v. Elena Moiseenko and Joseph Flora
</I>
	, in the New York State Supreme Court, Albany County
	(the &ldquo;Second New York Action&rdquo;). These suits allege that, in violation of their respective contractual, statutory and
	common law obligations to the Company, defendants PCG, Joseph Flora and former HMS employees Gambino, Ramos, Arendt, Curtin, Lange
	and Moiseenko unlawfully misappropriated HMS&rsquo;s confidential, proprietary and trade secret information and committed other
	wrong doing. The lawsuits seek damages and injunctive relief and assert causes of action including breach of contract, breach
	of fiduciary duty and misappropriation of trade secrets. HMS has sought injunctions in all three Actions.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	In July 2015, the
	court in the Texas Action found that HMS had proved the existence of unlawful conduct and had demonstrated a probable right to
	recovery at trial regarding its claims against PCG, Gambino and Ramos and that an injunction was necessary to avoid imminent and
	irreparable harm to the Company. As such, the Texas court issued an order that granted a temporary injunction against those defendants
	that was ordered to remain in place through the time of trial in the Texas Action (the &#8220;Texas Injunction&#8221;). As a condition
	to obtaining the Texas Injunction, HMS was required to post a surety bond in the amount of $0.5 million. In August 2015, HMS filed
	an appeal of the Texas Injunction to, among other things, expand upon the relief the trial court had awarded in order to enjoin
	PCG from providing TPL services to State Medicaid agencies through the time of trial, which PCG, Gambino and Ramos cross-appealed.
	Oral argument in this matter is set for March 2016. Additionally, in August 2015, PCG filed a counterclaim against the Company
	in the Texas Action claiming damages for alleged business disparagement and for tortious interference with an existing contract
	and prospective business relations, which HMS denied. In October 2015, PCG moved for partial summary judgment on HMS&#8217;s claims
	requesting that the court enter a judgment in favor of PCG on the issue of damages suffered in connection with certain PCG TPL
	proposals. On December 4, 2015, the Texas court denied PCG&#8217;s motion for partial summary judgment. On December 14, 2015,
	PCG filed an application for temporary injunction that would prohibit HMS from referring to certain conclusions made by the court
	in the Texas Injunction, which relate to the conduct of PCG or PCG&#8217;s employees, as &#8220;factual findings&#8221; in the
	Company&#8217;s future discussions with state authorities charged with awarding TPL contracts. If granted, PCG&#8217;s temporary
	injunction would last through the time of trial in the Texas Action, which is set for April 25, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	In May 2015, the court
	in the New York action issued an order granting HMS&#8217;s motion for spoliation against Curtin and Lange finding that these
	defendants had engaged in egregious misconduct regarding the wrongful destruction of evidence. The court ordered Curtin and Lange
	to repay the Company&#8217;s associated attorneys&#8217; fees and costs. Pursuant to the court&#8217;s order, HMS is seeking reimbursement
	of approximately $0.45 million from these defendants. In July 2015, following the Texas court&#8217;s ruling on the Texas Injunction,
	the court in the New York Action issued its decision and order on HMS&#8217;s motion for a preliminary injunction against Curtin,
	Lange and Arendt. The New York court found that HMS had successfully established a likelihood of prevailing on its non-solicitation
	claims against all three defendants and on its trade secret misappropriation claims against Curtin and Lange; however, the court
	held that injunctive relief in the New York Action was not necessary due to the Texas Injunction. The court&#8217;s order also
	preserved the Company&#8217;s right to again seek injunctive relief in the New York Action in the event of a change of status
	regarding the Texas Injunction. Trial in the New York Action is tentatively set for June 6, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	In August 2015, the
	court in the Second New York Action entered a temporary restraining order against defendants Moiseenko and Flora pending the court&#8217;s
	final determination of HMS&#8217;s application for a preliminary injunction in this matter. Flora generally denied HMS&#8217;s
	motion, and Moiseenko opposed it on its merits and filed a cross-motion to dismiss the complaint on the grounds of improper forum.
	On November 13, 2015, the court in the Second New York Action issued an order granting a preliminary injunction against Flora
	after concluding that HMS had demonstrated a probable right to recovery at trial on its claim that Flora had misappropriated and
	misused the Company&#8217;s trade secrets. The court&#8217;s order also granted Moiseenko&#8217;s motion to dismiss without prejudice
	to refiling in a proper forum.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 73; VALUE: 1 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 4PT SOLID">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	70
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage74"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	As HMS has disclosed
	in previous filings with the SEC, in July 2015, HMS received notice that reprocurement of its TPL contract with the New Jersey
	Department of Human Services had been awarded to PCG. On February 12, 2016, HMS filed a protest with the State of New Jersey Division
	of Purchase and Property challenging the award. After multiple contract extensions, HMS&#8217;s current TPL contract with the
	New Jersey Department of Human Services expires on March 31, 2016. In addition, in August 2015, the New York State Office of
	Medicaid General Inspector (&#8220;OMIG&#8221;) awarded HMS the new Medicaid Third Party Liability Match and Recovery Services
	contract. PCG filed a protest of the award with the New York Office of the State Comptroller, which HMS and OMIG opposed. On January
	8, 2016, HMS entered into an amendment to extend its existing TPL contract with OMIG through April 6, 2016. No decision has been
	rendered regarding the outcome of either protest.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	While HMS believes
	its legal claims are meritorious, there are inherent uncertainties in any litigation, and there can be no assurances that HMS
	will ultimately prevail at trial or in legal proceedings related to the lawsuits, such as protests, or that the rulings in these
	proceedings are or will be adequate to protect the Company&#8217;s confidential or trade secret information or that the rulings
	or outcomes in these matters would not have an adverse effect on the Company&#8217;s business, financial condition or operating
	results.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0">
	From time to time, HMS may be subject to investigations,
	legal proceedings and other disputes arising in the ordinary course of the Company&rsquo;s business, including but not limited
	to regulatory audits, billing and contractual disputes and employment-related matters. The Company&rsquo;s contractual relationships,
	including those with federal and state government entities, subject HMS operations, billing and business practices to scrutiny
	and audit by those entities and other multiple agencies and levels of government, as well as to frequent transitions and changes
	in the personnel responsible for oversight of the Company&rsquo;s contractual performance. Every so often, HMS may have contractual
	disputes with the Company&rsquo;s customers arising from differing interpretations of contractual provisions that define the Company&rsquo;s
	rights, obligations, scope of work or terms of payment, and with associated claims of liability for inaccurate or improper billing
	for reimbursement of contract fees, or for sanctions or damages for alleged performance deficiencies. Resolution of such disputes
	may involve litigation or may require that HMS accept some amount of loss or liability in order to avoid customer abrasion, negative
	marketplace perceptions and other disadvantageous results that could affect the Company&rsquo;s business, financial condition,
	results of operations and cash flows.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0">
	HMS records accruals for outstanding legal matters
	when it believes it is probable that a loss will be incurred and the amount can be reasonably estimated. The Company evaluates,
	on a quarterly basis, developments in legal matters that could affect the amount of any accrual and developments that would make
	a loss contingency both probable and reasonably estimable. If a loss contingency is not both probable and estimable, HMS does
	not establish an accrued liability
<B>
	.
</B>
	As of December 31, 2015, HMS accrued $2.6 million for litigation or other legal proceedings
	asserted or pending against the Company that could have, in the aggregate, a material adverse effect on its financial condition,
	results of operations or cash flows, and believe that adequate provision for any probable and estimable losses has been made in
	its consolidated financial statements. Although HMS believes that none of the Company&rsquo;s accruals for outstanding legal matters
	are material to the Company&rsquo;s financial position, the ultimate result of any current or future litigation or other legal
	proceedings, audits or disputes is inherently unpredictable and could result in liabilities that are higher than currently predicted.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<DIV DATA-TD-STATEMENT-TYPE="NOTE">
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	14.
	Customer Concentration
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.75IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN">
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.75IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN">
<I>
	(a)
	Geographic Information
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	The Company operates
	within the United States.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.75IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN">
<I>
	(b)
	Major Customers
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0">
	For the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, respectively, none of
	the Company&rsquo;s customers accounted for more than 10% of the Company&rsquo;s total revenue. For the year ended December 31,
	2013, one customer accounted for 22.3% of the Company&rsquo;s total revenue.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 74; VALUE: 1 -->

<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<I>
	(c) Concentration of Revenue
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	The list of the Company&#8217;s
	ten largest customers changes periodically. For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, the Company&#8217;s ten
	largest customers represented 44.0%, 40.1% and 47.2% of HMS&#8217; total revenue, respectively. The Company&#8217;s three largest
	customers accounted for 18.3%, 19.8% and 32.5% of total revenue for each of the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013,
	respectively. The Company&#8217;s agreements with the ten current largest customers expire between 2016 and 2020. In many instances,
	HMS provides services pursuant to agreements that may be renewed subject to a competitive reprocurement process. Several of the
	Company&#8217;s contracts, including those with some of the largest customers, may be terminated for convenience.
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<DIV DATA-TD-STATEMENT-TYPE="NOTE">
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	15.
	Subsequent Events
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<I>
	Stock-Based Compensation
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0">
	On February&nbsp;18, 2016, the Compensation Committee
	of the Board of Directors approved March 2, 2016 grants of stock option awards and restricted stock units to employees. The stock
	options and restricted stock units vest over 3 years. The Company estimates the fair value of these grants to be $12.9 million,
	utilizing the method and assumptions set forth in Note 10 &ndash; &ldquo;Stock-Based Compensation.&rdquo;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	In connection with
	the preparation of these audited consolidated financial statements, an evaluation of subsequent events was performed through the
	date these audited consolidated financial statements were issued and there are no other events that have occurred that would require
	adjustments or disclosure to the Company&#8217;s audited consolidated financial statements.
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<A NAME="F10K_022916P_HTM_A_031">
</A>
</P>
<DIV DATA-TD-STATEMENT-TYPE="NOTE">
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<B>
	SCHEDULE
	II &#8211; VALUATION AND QUALIFYING ACCOUNTS
</B>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<B>

<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_35"></A>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">

<EFX_EXHIBIT_10>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_10"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
	Exhibit 10.21
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN: 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-VARIANT: SMALL-CAPS">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN: 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-VARIANT: SMALL-CAPS">
<B>
	2015 Board of Director NQSO
	Agreement
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
	&lt;Participant Full Name&gt;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
	Dear
<B>
	&lt;Participant First Name&gt;
</B>
<I>
	&#9;
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
	Congratulations, you have been granted a stock option pursuant to the HMS Holdings Corp.
	Fourth Amended and Restated 2006 Stock Plan (the (&ldquo;
<B>
<I>
	Plan
</I>
</B>
	&rdquo;) for your service on the Board of Directors
	of HMS Holdings Corp. (the &ldquo;
<B>
<I>
	Company
</I>
</B>
	&rdquo;). A stock option grant gives you the right to purchase a specific
	number of shares of the Company&rsquo;s common stock at a fixed price, assuming that you satisfy conditions of the Plan and the
	award agreement. We would like you to have an opportunity to share in the continued success of the Company through this stock option
	grant under the Plan. The following represents a brief description of your grant. Additional details regarding your award are provided
	in the attached Nonqualified Stock Option Agreement (the &ldquo;
<B>
<I>
	Grant Agreement
</I>
</B>
	&rdquo;) and in the Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_36"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
	Stock Option Grant Summary:
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 60%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 1IN">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 46%; BORDER: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<B>
	Date of Grant
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 54%; BORDER-TOP: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<B>
	November 11, 2015
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-LEFT: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<B>
	Option Shares
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<B>
	&lt;Number of Shares Granted&gt;
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-LEFT: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<B>
	Exercise Price per Share
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<B>
	$&lt;XX.XX&gt;
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-LEFT: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<B>
	Exercisability
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<B>
	One-quarter of the Option Shares on December 31 of the year in which the Grant is made and an additional one-quarter on the last day of each of the first three quarters of the following calendar year.&nbsp;&nbsp;Each of those dates is an &ldquo;
<I>
	Exercisability Date
</I>
</B>
	.&rdquo;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-LEFT: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<B>
	Term Expiration Date
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<B>
	November 10, 2022
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0 0 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0 0 6PT">
	You have been granted a nonqualified stock option to purchase Shares of the Company&rsquo;s
	common stock. The total number of Shares under your grant is in the chart above under &ldquo;Option Shares&rdquo; and the price
	per share is under &ldquo;Exercise Price per Share.&rdquo;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0 0 6PT">
	The potential value of your stock option grant increases if the price of the Company&rsquo;s
	stock increases, but you also have to continue to provide services to the Company (except as the Grant Agreement provides) to actually
	receive such value. Of course, the value of the stock may go up and down over time.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0 0 6PT">
	You can&rsquo;t exercise the stock option (actually purchase the shares) until it becomes
	exercisable. Your stock option becomes exercisable as provided in the chart above under Exercisability, assuming you remain an
	employee of or member of the Board of Directors of the Company and subject to the terms in the Grant Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0 0 6PT">
	Whether or not you decide to exercise your stock option and purchase the stock is your
	decision, and, you have until the stock option expires (which will be no later than the
<I>
	seventh
</I>
	anniversary of the Date
	of Grant, but can end earlier in various situations) to make that decision.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
	Once you have purchased the Shares, you will own them and may decide whether to hold the
	stock, sell the stock or give the stock to someone as a gift.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
<I>
	You can access the Merrill Lynch portal updates and information: https://www.benefits.ml.com.
	Please email IR@hms.com
<B>
</B>
	with any questions.
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-VARIANT: SMALL-CAPS">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-VARIANT: SMALL-CAPS">
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 1 -->

	&nbsp;

<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-VARIANT: SMALL-CAPS">
<B>
	HMS Holdings Corp.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-VARIANT: SMALL-CAPS">
<B>
	Nonqualified Stock Option Grant
	Agreement for Board of Directors
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0 0 0 2.5IN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	HMS Holdings Corp. (the &ldquo;
<B>
<I>
	Company
</I>
</B>
	&rdquo;) has granted you an option
	(the &ldquo;
<B>
<I>
	Option
</I>
</B>
	&rdquo;) under the HMS Holdings Corp. Fourth Amended and Restated 2006 Stock Plan (as it may be
	amended from time to time) (the &ldquo;
<B>
<I>
	Plan
</I>
</B>
	&rdquo;). The Option lets you purchase a specified number (the &ldquo;
<B>
<I>
	Option
	Shares
</I>
</B>
	&rdquo;) of Shares of the Company&rsquo;s common stock, at a specified price per Share (the &ldquo;
<B>
<I>
	Exercise
	Price
</I>
</B>
	&rdquo;).&#9;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	The individualized communication you received (the &ldquo;
<B>
<I>
	Cover
	Letter
</I>
</B>
	&rdquo;) provides the details for your Option. It specifies the number of Option Shares, the Exercise Price, the
	Date of Grant, the schedule for exercisability, and the latest date the Option will expire (the &ldquo;
<B>
<I>
	Term Expiration Date
</I>
</B>
	&rdquo;).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	The Option is subject in all respects to the applicable provisions of
	the Plan. This Grant Agreement does not cover all of the rules that apply to the Option under the Plan; please refer to the Plan
	document. Capitalized terms are defined either further below in this grant agreement (the &ldquo;
<B>
<I>
	Grant Agreement
</I>
</B>
	&rdquo;)
	or in the Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
</P>
<!-- FIELD: RULE-PAGE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PT; BORDER-TOP: BLACK 1PT SOLID; WIDTH: 100%">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /RULE-PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
	The Plan document is available on the Merrill Lynch website. The Prospectus for the Plan,
	the Company&rsquo;s S-8, Annual Report on Form 10-K, and other filings the Company makes with the Securities and Exchange Commission
	are available for your review under the Investor Relations tab on the Company&rsquo;s web site. You may also obtain paper copies
	of these documents upon request to the Company&rsquo;s Investor Relations department (IR@HMS.com).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
	Neither the Company nor anyone else is making any representations or promises regarding the
	duration of your service, exercisability of the Option, the value of the Company's stock or of this Option, or the Company's prospects.
	The Company is not providing any advice regarding tax consequences to you or regarding your decisions regarding the Option; you
	agree to rely only upon your own personal advisors.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-VARIANT: SMALL-CAPS">
<B>
	No one may sell, transfer, or distribute the Option
	or the securities that may be purchased upon exercising the Option without an effective registration statement relating thereto
	or an opinion of counsel satisfactory to HMS Holdings Corp. or other information and representations satisfactory to it that such
	registration is not required.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-VARIANT: SMALL-CAPS">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">

<B>
	&nbsp;

</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	In addition to the Plan&rsquo;s terms and restrictions,
	the following terms and restrictions apply:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_37"></A>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 95PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	Option
<BR>
	Exercisability
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	While your Option remains in effect under the
<B>
	Option Expiration
</B>
	section, you may exercise any exercisable portions of the Option (and buy the Option Shares) under
	the timing rules of this section, provided that you may not exercise the Option for fewer than 100 full shares at any particular
	time unless fewer than 100 remain unexercised.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0 0 0 2.5IN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -2.5IN">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 95PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Option will become exercisable on the schedule provided in the Cover Letter to this Grant
	Agreement assuming that through each Exercisability Date, (i) if you received the Option in your capacity as an employee of
	the Company, you remain an employee or (ii) if you received the Option in your capacity as a member of the
	Company&rsquo;s Board, you remain a member of the Company&rsquo;s Board. Any fractional shares will be carried forward to the
	following Exercisability Date, unless the Committee selects a different treatment. For purposes of this Grant Agreement,
	employment with the Company will include employment with any Affiliate whose employees are then eligible to receive Awards
	under the Plan. Unless the Committee determines otherwise, if an entity employing you ceases to be an Affiliate, your
	employment with the Company will be treated as ended even though you continue to be employed by that entity.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0 0 0 1.5IN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -1.5IN">
<SUP>
	&nbsp;
</SUP>
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 95PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Exercisability will accelerate fully on your disability or death. For this purpose,
	&ldquo;
<B>
<I>
	disability
</I>
</B>
	&rdquo; means permanent and total disability as defined by Section&nbsp;22(e)(3) of the Code.
	Exercisability will continue and increase (until fully exercisable) over the two years following your date of Retirement.
	&ldquo;
<B>
<I>
	Retirement
</I>
</B>
	&rdquo; for this purpose means cessation of service on or after attaining age 60 and
	completing five years of service with the Company.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0 0 0 2.5IN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_38"></A>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 95PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	Change in Control
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
</B>
	If a Change in Control occurs, your Option will be treated as provided
	in Section 11 of the Plan if, within 24 months following the Change in Control, your
	employment or service ends on a termination without cause (as determined by the Committee or the Board), provided also that the
	Option will remain outstanding for 12 months following such termination but not beyond the Term Expiration Date.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 95PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	Option Expiration
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
</B>
	The Option will expire no later than the close of business on
	the Term Expiration Date. Unexercisable portions of the Option expire immediately when you cease to be employed (unless you are
	concurrently remaining or becoming a member of the Board, or, for a Board member, concurrently remaining or becoming an employee
	of the Company). If the Company terminates your employment or service for cause or if you violate any then applicable restrictive
	covenant agreement (such as agreements pertaining to confidentiality, intellectual property, nonsolicitation, and/or noncompetition),
	the Option will immediately expire without regard to whether it is then exercisable.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -1.5IN; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 95PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Exercisable portions of the Option remain exercisable until the first to occur of the
	following (the &ldquo;
<B>
<I>
	Final Exercise Date
</I>
</B>
	&rdquo;), each as defined further in the Plan or the Grant
	Agreement:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Three months (measured to the corresponding date in the month) after your employment (or directorship) ends if you resign or
	if the Company terminates your employment or service without cause (as determined under the Plan), except as provided above under
<B>
	Change in Control
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>

</TD>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN; MARGIN: 0 0 0 0.25IN">

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">

	The Committee can override the expiration provisions of this Grant Agreement.
</TD>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1.5IN">

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_39"></A>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 95PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	Method of
<BR>
	Exercise and
<BR>
	Payment for
<BR>
	Shares
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
</B>
	Subject to this Grant Agreement and the Plan, you may exercise the Option
	only by providing a written notice (or notice through another previously
	approved method, which could include a web-based or voice- or e-mail system)
	to the Secretary of the Company or to whomever the Committee designates, received on or before
	the date the Option expires. Each such notice must satisfy whatever then-current procedures apply to that Option and must contain
	such representations (statements from you about your situation) as the Company requires. You must, at the same time, pay the Exercise
	Price using one or more of the following methods:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -1.5IN; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1.5IN">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1.5IN">
<B>
	Cash/Check
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
	cash or check in the amount of the Exercise Price payable to the order of the Company;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0 0 0 2IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1.5IN">
<B>
	Cashless
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
	an approved cashless exercise method, including directing the Company
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0 0 0 2IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1.5IN">
<B>
	Exercise
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
	to send the stock certificates (or other acceptable evidence of ownership) to be issued under the Option to a licensed broker
	acceptable to the Company as your agent in exchange for the broker&rsquo;s tendering to the Company cash (or acceptable cash equivalents)
	equal to the Exercise Price and, if you so elect, any required tax withholdings;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -1.5IN; MARGIN: 0 0 0 2IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -1.5IN; MARGIN: 0 0 0 2IN">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1.5IN">
<B>
	Net Exercise
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
	by delivery of a notice of &ldquo;net
	exercise&rdquo; to or as directed by the Company, as a result of which you will receive (i) the number of shares underlying the
	portion of the Option being exercised less (ii) such number of shares as is equal to (A) the aggregate Exercise Price for the portion
	of the Option being exercised divided by (B) the Fair Market Value on the date of exercise;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -1.5IN; MARGIN: 0 0 0 2IN">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -1.5IN; MARGIN: 0 0 0 2IN">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -1.5IN; MARGIN: 0 0 0 2IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1.5IN">
<B>
	Stock
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
	if permitted by the Committee, by delivery of Shares owned by you, valued at their Fair Market Value, provided (i) applicable
	law then permits such method of payment, (ii) you owned such Shares, if acquired directly from the Company, for such minimum period
	of time, if any, as the Committee may establish in its discretion, and (iii) the Shares are not subject to any repurchase, forfeiture,
	unfulfilled vesting, or other similar restrictions; or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -1.5IN; MARGIN: 0 0 0 2IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1.5IN">
</TD>
<TD>
	any combination of the above permitted forms for payment.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0 0 0 2IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_40"></A>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 95PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	Withholding
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Issuing the Option Shares is contingent on satisfaction of all obligations with respect
	to required tax or other required withholdings (for example, in the U.S., Federal, state, and local taxes). The Company may take
	any action permitted under Section 14(c) of the Plan to satisfy such obligation, including satisfying the tax obligations by (i)
	reducing the number of Option Shares to be issued to you in connection with any exercise of the Option by that number of Option
	Shares (valued at their Fair Market Value on the date of exercise) that would equal all taxes required to be withheld (at their
	minimum withholding levels), (ii) accepting payment of the withholdings from a broker in connection with a Cashless Exercise of
	the Option or directly from you, or (iii) taking any other action under Section 14(c) of the Plan. If a fractional share remains
	after deduction for required withholding, the Company will pay you the value of the fraction in cash.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -1IN; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1IN">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_41"></A>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 95PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	Compliance with Law
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	You may not exercise the Option if the Company&rsquo;s issuing stock upon such exercise would violate any applicable Federal or state securities laws
	or other laws or regulations. You may not sell or otherwise dispose of the Option Shares in violation of applicable law. As part
	of this prohibition, you may not use the Cashless Exercise methods if the Company&rsquo;s insider trading policy then prohibits
	you from selling to the market.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 95PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	Additional Conditions to Exercise
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company may postpone issuing and delivering any Option Shares for so long as the Company determines to be advisable to satisfy the following:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0 0 0 2IN">
	its completing or amending any securities registration or qualification of the Option
	Shares
<I>
	or
</I>
	its or your satisfying any exemption from registration under any Federal or state law, rule, or regulation;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0 0 0 2IN">
	its receiving proof it considers satisfactory that a person seeking to exercise the
	Option after your death is entitled to do so;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -2IN; MARGIN: 0 0 0 2IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0 0 0 2IN">
	your complying with any requests for representations under the Plan; and
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -2IN; MARGIN: 0 0 0 2IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0 0 0 2IN">
	your complying with any Federal, state, or local tax withholding obligations.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -2IN; MARGIN: 0 0 0 2IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_42"></A>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 95PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	Additional Representations from You
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	If you exercise the Option at a time when the Company does not have a current registration
	statement (generally on Form S-8) under the Securities Act of 1933 (the &ldquo;
<B>
<I>
	Act
</I>
</B>
	&rdquo;) that covers
	issuances of shares to you, you must comply with the following before the Company will issue the Option Shares to you. You
	must &mdash;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0 0 0 2IN">
	represent to the Company, in a manner satisfactory to the Company&rsquo;s counsel,
	that you are acquiring the Option Shares for your own account and not with a view to reselling or distributing the Option Shares;
	and
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -2IN; MARGIN: 0 0 0 2IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0 0 0 2IN">
	agree that you will not sell, transfer, or otherwise dispose of the Option Shares
	unless:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -2IN; MARGIN: 0 0 0 2IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0 0 0 2.5IN">
	a registration statement under the Act is effective at the time of disposition
	with respect to the Option Shares you propose to sell, transfer, or otherwise dispose of; or
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -2.5IN; MARGIN: 0 0 0 2.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0 0 0 2.5IN">
	the Company has received an opinion of counsel or other information and representations
	it considers satisfactory to the effect that, because of Rule 144 under the Act or otherwise, no registration under the Act is
	required.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -1IN; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1IN">

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_43"></A>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 95PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	No Employment Effect on Other or Relationship
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
</B>
	Nothing in this Grant Agreement restricts the Company&rsquo;s rights or those of any
	of its Affiliates to terminate your employment or other relationship at any time and for any or no reason. The termination of
	employment or other relationship, whether by the Company or any of its Affiliates or otherwise, and regardless of the
	reason for such termination, has the consequences provided for under the Plan and any applicable employment or severance agreement
	or plan.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 95PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	Not a Shareholder
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
</B>
	You understand and agree that the Company will not consider
	you a shareholder for any purpose with respect to any of the Option Shares until you have exercised the Option, paid for the shares,
	and received evidence of ownership.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 95PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	No Effect on
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
</B>
	You understand and agree that the existence of the Option will
	not affect in any
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_44"></A>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 95PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	Running Business
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
</B>
	way the right or power of the Company or its shareholders to make
	or authorize any adjustments, recapitalizations, reorganizations, or other changes in the Company&rsquo;s capital structure or
	its business, or any merger or consolidation of the Company, or any issuance of bonds, debentures, preferred or other stock, with
	preference ahead of or convertible into, or otherwise affecting the Company&rsquo;s common stock or the rights thereof, or the
	dissolution or liquidation of the Company, or any sale or transfer of all or any part of its assets or business, or any other
	corporate act or proceeding, whether or not of a similar character to those described above.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -1.5IN; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 95PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	Governing Law
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
</B>
	The laws of the State of New York will govern all matters relating to
	the Option, without regard to the principles of conflict of laws.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 95PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	Notices
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Any notice you give to the Company must follow the procedures then in effect. If no
	other procedures apply, you must send your notice in writing by hand or by mail to the office of the Company&rsquo;s Secretary
	(or to the Chair of the Committee if you are then serving as the sole Secretary). If mailed, you should address it to the Company&rsquo;s
	Secretary (or the Chair of the Committee) at the Company&rsquo;s then corporate headquarters, unless the Company directs optionees
	to send notices to another corporate department or to a third party administrator or specifies another method of transmitting
	notice. The Company and the Committee will address any notices to you using its standard electronic communications methods or
	at your office or home address as reflected on the Company&rsquo;s personnel or other business records. You and the Company may
	change the address for notice by like notice to the other, and the Company can also change the address for notice by general announcements
	to optionees.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -1.5IN; MARGIN: 0 0 0 1.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 95PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	Amendment
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Subject to any required action by the Committee or the shareholders of the Company,
	the Company may cancel the Option and provide a new Award in its place, provided that the Award so replaced will satisfy all of
	the requirements of the Plan as of the date such new Award is made and no such action will adversely affect the Option to the
	extent then exercisable.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0">
	Plan Governs
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Wherever a conflict may arise between the terms of this
	Grant Agreement and the terms of the Plan, the terms of the Plan will control. The Committee may adjust the number of Option
	Shares and the Exercise Price and other terms of the Option from time to time as the Plan provides.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;Page 6
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<B>
	Exhibit 10.22
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-VARIANT: SMALL-CAPS">
<B>
	2015 Board of Director RSU
	Agreement
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-VARIANT: SMALL-CAPS">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&lt;Participant Full Name&gt;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Dear
<B>
	&lt;Participant First Name&gt;
</B>
<I>
	&#9;
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Congratulations, you have been granted restricted stock units (&ldquo;
<B>
<I>
	RSUs
</I>
</B>
	&rdquo;)
	pursuant to the HMS Holdings Corp. Fourth Amended and Restated 2006 Stock Plan (the (&ldquo;
<B>
<I>
	Plan
</I>
</B>
	&rdquo;) for your
	service on the Board of Directors of HMS Holdings Corp. (the &ldquo;
<B>
<I>
	Company
</I>
</B>
	&rdquo;). A restricted stock unit entitles
	you to receive a share of the Company&rsquo;s common stock at a future date, assuming that you satisfy conditions of the Plan and
	the award agreement. We would like you to have an opportunity to share in the continued success of the Company through these RSUs
	under the Plan. The following represents a brief description of your grant. Additional details regarding your award are provided
	in the attached Restricted Stock Unit Agreement (the &ldquo;
<B>
<I>
	Grant Agreement
</I>
</B>
	&rdquo;) and in the Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_45"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Restricted Stock Unit Grant Summary:
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="2" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="WIDTH: 60%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 46%; BORDER: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<B>
	Date of Grant
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 54%; BORDER-TOP: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<B>
	November 11, 2015
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-LEFT: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<B>
	RSU Shares
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<B>
	&lt;Number of Shares Granted&gt;
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-LEFT: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<B>
	Vesting Schedule
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<B>
	One-quarter of the RSU Shares on December 31 of the year in which the Grant is made and an additional one-quarter on the last day of each of the first three quarters of the following calendar year.&nbsp;&nbsp;Each of those dates is a &ldquo;
<I>
	Vesting Date
</I>
</B>
	.&rdquo;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	You have been granted RSUs for Shares of the Company&rsquo;s common stock for the total number of Shares specified under &ldquo;RSU
	Shares&rdquo; in the chart above.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	The potential value of your RSUs increases if the price of the Company&rsquo;s stock increases, but you also have to continue
	to provide services to the Company (except as the Grant Agreement provides) to actually receive such value. Of course, the value
	of the stock may go up and down over time.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	You will not receive the Shares represented by the RSUs unless and until the RSUs vest. Your RSUs vest as provided in the chart
	above under &ldquo;Vesting,&rdquo; assuming you remain a member of the Board of Directors of the Company and subject to the terms
	in the Grant Agreement.
<SUP>
</SUP>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Once you have received the Shares, you will own them and may decide whether to hold the stock, sell the stock or give the stock
	to someone as a gift.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">

	You can access the Merrill Lynch portal updates and information: https://www.benefits.ml.com.
	Please email IR@hms.com
<B>
</B>
	with any questions.
</I>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">

</I>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 12PT; FONT-VARIANT: SMALL-CAPS">
<B>
	HMS Holdings
	Corp.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 12PT; FONT-VARIANT: SMALL-CAPS">
<B>
	Restricted
	Stock Unit Grant Agreement for Board of Directors
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 2.5IN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&#9;HMS Holdings Corp. (the &ldquo;
<B>
<I>
	Company
</I>
</B>
	&rdquo;) has granted you restricted
	stock units (the &ldquo;
<B>
<I>
	RSUs
</I>
</B>
	&rdquo;) under the HMS Holdings Corp. Fourth Amended and Restated 2006 Stock Plan (as
	it may be amended from time to time) (the &ldquo;
<B>
<I>
	Plan
</I>
</B>
	&rdquo;). Each RSU lets you receive a Share (an &ldquo;
<B>
<I>
	RSU
	Share
</I>
</B>
	&rdquo;) of the Company&rsquo;s common stock, upon satisfaction of the conditions to receipt.&#9;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	The individualized communication you received (the &ldquo;
<B>
<I>
	Cover
	Letter
</I>
</B>
	&rdquo;) provides the details for your RSUs. It specifies the number of RSU Shares, the Date of Grant, and the schedule
	for vesting, with the related vesting dates (&ldquo;
<B>
<I>
	Vesting Dates
</I>
</B>
	&rdquo;).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	The RSUs are subject in all respects to the applicable provisions
	of the Plan. This Grant Agreement does not cover all of the rules that apply to the RSUs under the Plan; please refer to the Plan
	document. Capitalized terms are defined either further below in this grant agreement (the &ldquo;
<B>
<I>
	Grant Agreement
</I>
</B>
	&rdquo;)
	or in the Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<!-- FIELD: RULE-PAGE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 1PT; BORDER-TOP: RGB(77,74,74) 3PT SOLID; WIDTH: 100%">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /RULE-PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The Plan document is available on the Merrill Lynch website. The Prospectus for the Plan,
	the Company&rsquo;s S-8, Annual Report on Form 10-K, and other filings the Company makes with the Securities and Exchange Commission
	are available for your review under the Investor Relations tab on the Company&rsquo;s web site. You may also obtain paper copies
	of these documents upon request to the Company&rsquo;s Investor Relations department (IR@HMS.com).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Neither the Company nor anyone else is making any representations or promises regarding
	the duration of your service, vesting of the RSUs, the value of the Company's stock or of these RSUs, or the Company's prospects.
	The Company is not providing any advice regarding tax consequences to you or regarding your decisions regarding the RSUs; you agree
	to rely only upon your own personal advisors.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-VARIANT: SMALL-CAPS">
<B>
	No one may sell, transfer, or distribute the
	RSUs or the securities that may be received under them without an effective registration statement relating thereto or an opinion
	of counsel satisfactory to HMS Holdings Corp. or other information and representations satisfactory to it that such registration
	is not required.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>

	terms and restrictions apply:
